intro: Deppea tubana, commonly known as the tubular deppea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Deppea tubana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
